intro: Eugenia simmondsiae, commonly known as the red-fruit eugenia, is a species of flowering plant in the Myrtaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and produces small, fragrant white flowers. After flowering, it bears small, bright red fruits that are edible and often used in local cuisines. Its ornamental value and unique fruit make it a notable species in botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
